Travel Blog is an open-source location and notes. It tries to minimize battery use. It also does not require internet access.
 
 To use, first start with New Trip from the menu. This will be the KML filename of the blog (located in /TravelBlog/ on your SD card). Now when you want to log your location, just click on New Post. This brings up a new page where you can type a name and description. While you are typing, it finds your location by GPS (if enabled and available), or by WiFi / Cell-id (network). If you are unhappy with the location, you can later edit the location on a map.
 
 Now click Save, or Cancel to cancel. You can edit a post by clicking on it, and you can select delete post by long-clicking on a post. When editing you a given the opportunity to edit the name and description, and optionally to edit the location of your post by clicking on the location coordinates.
 
 Whenever you choose, you can view your trip on a Google map on your device by choosing Map Trip from the menu. You can copy the KML blog file manually to do what you choose with it, or you can send it via email or wherever your device can send it to by choosing Send Trip from the menu.
 
 What works well for us is to install the Android Dropbox app, register with Dropbox, and then Send the KML file to your Dropbox public folder. In Dropbox you can get a link to your file which you can enter into the Search Maps box in Google Maps. This works from either the desktop Google Maps, or the mobile Google Maps app. You can then share this map with friends, or add it to your favourite Blogging website such as Blogger. This way, your family, friends or colleagues can also know what you are up to.
 
 Later you can Open Trip to load old trips, or select new Trip again to start again. Your last Trip is also loaded on start-up. Nothing runs in the background.
 
For more information as well as complete User Guide, please visit our pages at http://code.google.com/p/travel-blog-android/
 
Happy travelling!
 
The Travel Blog Team
